channel.title: blockchain on Rhombus Project Wiki
channel.description: Recent content in blockchain on Rhombus Project Wiki

item.title: Latest Bitcoin codebase
item.description: RHOM is hosted by its own blockchain and is not a token built on another chain (i.e. ERC-20 tokens). Advantages Being built on the latest Bitcoin codebase not only allows the Rhombus platform to benefit from both Bitcoin’s stability and security, but also enables developers to leverage and easily fork any product, service and technology development from the Bitcoin developer community. Recent Bitcoin developments implemented in Rhombus include but are not limited to:

item.title: Specifications
item.description: Blockchain Codebase Always up-to-date with latest Bitcoin Core Consensus mechanism Rhombus Proof-of-Stake (RPoS) Block time 150 seconds (Quicker then BTC) Block size 2 MB (2× larger than BTC) Coin supply Total & circulating supply between 1-11 billion RHOM (check link for exact number) ICO Disptrubtion max 200 Million RHOM Airdrop Distrubution max 10 billion RHOM Staking Block reward 100 RHOM Coin maturity 192 confirmations (~8 hours) Yearly interest rate 0.
